title: Authorizes New York city to grant real property tax credit for certain sewer improvement made to prevent backup in residential structure
summary: Authorizes governing body of the city of New York to pass local law allowing a credit against real property tax for owner-occupied one, two, three or four family residence for expenses incurred in making improvements to prevent sewer and drainage backups.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2607

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 26, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Local Government

       AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in  relation  to  authorizing
         the governing body of the city of New York to allow certain homeowners
         a  real  property  tax  credit  for  the  cost of sewer improvement on
         certain dwellings

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  real  property  tax  law  is amended by adding a new
    2  section 470 to read as follows:
    3    S 470. TAX CREDIT AFFORDED CERTAIN HOMEOWNERS FOR THE COST OF IMPROVE-
    4  MENTS MADE TO PREVENT SEWER  BACKUPS  INTO  CERTAIN  DWELLINGS.  1.  THE
    5  GOVERNING  BODY  OF  THE  CITY  OF  NEW  YORK  IS  HEREBY AUTHORIZED AND
    6  EMPOWERED TO ADOPT, AFTER PUBLIC HEARING, IN ACCORDANCE WITH SUBDIVISION
    7  TWO OF THIS SECTION, A LOCAL LAW, ORDINANCE OR RESOLUTION PROVIDING  FOR
    8  A  CREDIT  ON  TAXES  OF SAID MUNICIPAL CORPORATION, FOR A PERIOD OF ONE
    9  YEAR, ON REAL PROPERTY CONTAINING A  ONE,  TWO,  THREE  OR  FOUR  FAMILY
   10  DWELLING  BY AN AMOUNT CONSTITUTING THE COST OF ANY IMPROVEMENTS MADE BY
   11  THE OWNER OF SUCH DWELLINGS TO PREVENT SEWER  AND  DRAINAGE  BACKUPS  IN
   12  SUCH DWELLINGS.
   13    2.  ANY SUCH LOCAL LAW, ORDINANCE OR RESOLUTION SHALL PROVIDE THAT THE
   14  OWNER OF A ONE, TWO, THREE OR FOUR FAMILY DWELLING SHALL  PROVIDE  PROOF
   15  OF  THE COST OF ANY SUCH IMPROVEMENTS AS DESCRIBED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF
   16  THIS SECTION WHEREUPON A TAX CREDIT IN AN AMOUNT CONSTITUTING SUCH  COST
   17  SHALL BE GRANTED FOR THE NEXT SUCCEEDING TAX PERIOD.
   18    S 2.  This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07244-01-1
memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2607

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the real property tax law, in relation
to authorizing the governing body of the
city of
New York to allow certain homeowners a real property
tax credit for the cost of sewer improvement
on certain dwellings

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
This bill would allow New York City
to give a tax credit on real property taxes of one, two or three
family dwellings for the cost of any improvements made by the owner
to prevent sewer and drainage back ups.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
This bill would allow the City Council
of New York to allow a credit for one year on real property taxes for
a one, two or three family dwelling.

JUSTIFICATION:
This bill would encourage homeowners to maintain and
improve their homes by giving them a credit for the cost of sewer and
drainage improvements.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2004  - Referred to Real Property Taxation
2003  - Referred to Real Property Taxation
2002  - Referred to Real Property Taxation
2001  - Referred to Real Property Taxation
2000  - Referred to Real Property Taxation
1999  - Referred to Real Property Taxation
1998  - Referred to Real Property Taxation
1997  - Referred to Real Property Taxation

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
Not known.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
